xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9" xmlns="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-image/1.1" xmlns:video="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-video/1.1">
https://tmrev.io/movie/1040009-ABBA: Music in Review 1973-1982 2022-11-27
https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/588vGPYdyBt87V0G3m5cIvlaq5p.jpg ABBA was extremely successful in the 1970s and 1980s and sold over 400 million records worldwide. Their music is still extremely influential and had a massive renaissance through the global influence of the stage phenomenon 'Mamma Mia'. Using rare archival footage, a team of music critics and active musicians reviews every ABBA album, from the pre-'Waterloo' era until 'The Visitors'. ABBA: Music in Review 1973-1982
